messages.content:
You are an AI coding assistant. You help users with coding tasks using the following tools:

<tool_definition name='list_dir'>
  description: Lists directory contents at a specified path relative to the workspace
  parameters:
    - relative_workspace_path (string): Path to list contents of
  format_rules:
    - Tool calls must use XML-style tags
    - Parameters must be space-separated key=value pairs
    - String values must be quoted
</tool_definition>
<tool_definition name='read_file'>
  description: Reads file contents, with support for both full file and partial reading
  parameters:
    - relative_workspace_path (string): Path to the file
    - should_read_entire_file (boolean): Whether to read entire file
    - start_line_one_indexed (integer): Start line (1-based)
    - end_line_one_indexed_inclusive (integer): End line (1-based)
  format_rules:
    - Tool calls must use XML-style tags
    - Parameters must be space-separated key=value pairs
    - String values must be quoted
</tool_definition>
<tool_definition name='edit_file'>
  description: Makes code changes to specified files based on instructions
  parameters:
    - target_file (string): File to edit
    - instructions (string): What changes to make
    - code_edit (string): The actual edit content
  format_rules:
    - Tool calls must use XML-style tags
    - Parameters must be space-separated key=value pairs
    - String values must be quoted
</tool_definition>
<tool_definition name='run_terminal_cmd'>
  description: Executes terminal commands with configurable execution options
  parameters:
    - command (string): Command to execute
    - is_background (boolean): Whether to run in background
    - require_user_approval (boolean): Whether user must approve
  format_rules:
    - Tool calls must use XML-style tags
    - Parameters must be space-separated key=value pairs
    - String values must be quoted
</tool_definition>
Turn up the heat a little

I'll help you with that.
<tool name='set_thermostat_delta'>delta=1.5</tool>
<tool_response name='set_thermostat_delta'>{"status": "success", "data": {"previous_temperature": 24, "temperature": 25.5, "delta": 1.5}}</tool_response>
I've increased the temperature by 1.5°C to 25.5°C.

  description: Lists directory contents at a specified path relative to the workspace
  parameters:
    - relative_workspace_path (string): Path to list contents of
  format_rules:
    - Tool calls must use XML-style tags
    - Parameters must be space-separated key=value pairs
    - String values must be quoted
</tool_definition>
<tool_definition name='read_file'>
  description: Reads file contents, with support for both full file and partial reading
  parameters:
    - relative_workspace_path (string): Path to the file
    - should_read_entire_file (boolean): Whether to read entire file
    - start_line_one_indexed (integer): Start line (1-based)
    - end_line_one_indexed_inclusive (integer): End line (1-based)
  format_rules:
    - Tool calls must use XML-style tags
    - Parameters must be space-separated key=value pairs
    - String values must be quoted
</tool_definition>
<tool_definition name='edit_file'>
  description: Makes code changes to specified files based on instructions
  parameters:
    - target_file (string): File to edit
    - instructions (string): What changes to make
    - code_edit (string): The actual edit content
  format_rules:
    - Tool calls must use XML-style tags
    - Parameters must be space-separated key=value pairs
    - String values must be quoted
</tool_definition>
<tool_definition name='run_terminal_cmd'>
  description: Executes terminal commands with configurable execution options
  parameters:
    - command (string): Command to execute
    - is_background (boolean): Whether to run in background
    - require_user_approval (boolean): Whether user must approve
  format_rules:
    - Tool calls must use XML-style tags
    - Parameters must be space-separated key=value pairs
    - String values must be quoted
</tool_definition>
How's the weather in Hong Kong?

I'll help you with that.
<tool name='get_weather'>location="Hong Kong"</tool>
<tool_response name='get_weather'>{"status": "success", "data": {"temperature": 3, "unit": "C", "conditions": "clear"}}</tool_response>
